ca.mcgill.ecse211.main_package

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.main_package.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for the robot's navigation in a grid. It obtains the correct heading, rotates the robot towards it and moves the robot to the next point. This class provides the methods necessary for all movements in the field after each localization.
    Author:
    Tritin

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Navigation()

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean destination_reached(double xf, double yf)
      This boolean method indicates to the robot if a destination is reached yet.
      static double euclidian_error(double dx, double dy)
      This method returns the Euclidean distance.
      void travelTo(double xf, double yf)
      This method allows the robot to travel to a destination (point on the field).
      void turn_to_angle(double angle)
      This method calculates the smallest angle to rotate for a desired heading and turns on a dime to it.
      void turn_to_destination(double xf, double yf)
      this method calculates the smallest angle to rotate to the correct heading and then turns on a dime to reach it, inputs are the desired x and y positions

        Parameters:

        dy - Change in y

      • turn_to_angle

        public void turn_to_angle(double angle)
        This method calculates the smallest angle to rotate for a desired heading and turns on a dime to it.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle position of destination point

      • turn_to_destination

        public void turn_to_destination(double xf,
                                double yf)
        this method calculates the smallest angle to rotate to the correct heading and then turns on a dime to reach it, inputs are the desired x and y positions
        Parameters:
        xf - x coordinate of destination point
        yf - y coordinate of destination point

      • destination_reached

        public boolean destination_reached(double xf,
                                   double yf)
        This boolean method indicates to the robot if a destination is reached yet. (within some error.)
        Parameters:
        xf - x coordinate of destination
        yf - y coordinate of destination
        Returns:
        True if reached, false otherwise
